Review Title: Adding another waterfall to the list....
Review Text: This quite a famous waterfall mostly owing to the fact that there is a hotel built right at the top of the waterfall which was considered THE Honeymoon Hotel among Sri Lankans in the late 1900s..The hotel is still there and freshly renovated (according to what we heard). Google directions are accurate.... Wattegama - Elkaduwa road is slightly bumpy and narrow. There is a turnofff from this main road and you have travel about 1.5 kms to reach the waterfall. The access road was freshly carpeted at the time of our visit. The road is wide enough to park vehicles. There is a entranceway from where you have to buy a ticket (LKR 150 per local) and climb down a few steps leading to a pathway upto the waterfall. There is also a railing (not the safest though) which you can use to cross the waterfall in the middle. There was a summer hut, washrooms and a place to change clothes. It also seemed as if they have built a place to bathe as well. (Not so sure about this). The waterfall itself wasn't that impressive. (We visited a couple of weeks after heavy rains though). We went there on our way to Sembuwatte Lake and spent only around 20 mts there. (Hence our rating reflects only what we thought of the waterfall and the surrounding view.)

Beautiful waterfall especially during rainy season. However the pathway is slippery so watch out and also be careful with the Leeches. Carry salt water or sanitizer. Try to always get a guide to take you. They are simple folk at the ticket office. We were taken by Vishwanathan. Wear good shoes which have a decent grip. It’s a very short walk but best be safe than sorry!

Review Title: Nice calm place to spend an evening
Review Text: Beautiful waterfall. It falls in 2 sections and when combined it is very wide. Recently some development activities have happened here to market this place as a leisure park. Some huts with sitting areas, a natural pool and changing rooms are available. But it’s not worth the 100 rupees entrance fee you have to pay. You can also walk up very closer to the waterfall. Parking area is also available.

This waterfall gives a soothing taste for a sour eye. really is a beautiful waterfall. Be informed that if you are going near waterfall you have to buy a ticket of 300/= which is in my point of view not a reasonable charge. Be aware of leeches in raing season

Review Title: Scenic Waterfall – Protect yourself from Leeches
Review Text: A group of 15 of us, travelling with ‘Flamingo Lanka Tours’ visited the lower reaches of the Hunnas Falls, situated at Elkaduwa in Matale District.  We travelled by coach up to the parking area.  The entrance fee payable at the simple office at the entrance gate costs Rs 100 per person.  After purchasing the ticket, we walked along the designated path towards the upper reaches of the falls.  Although we were advised to take precautions, we encountered only a few leeches, possibly because it was a dry morning. You can see the falls from a distance as you come along the main road.  The falls consist of two sections that are distinctly different.  At the bottom of the falls is a small pond and a little hut where you can sit and enjoy the view.  The water fall is about 40 metres high.  The virgin beauty is unaffected as there are no commercial buildings nearby.  The path by the side of the falls is moist and slippery and visitors need to be careful of the thorny bushes along the way. We stayed here for about 90 minutes enjoying the quiet, the scenic beauty and the monkeys!

We had a visit there while staying at Amaya Hunas falls, Hunnasgiriya waterfall is of two parts, upper and lower. Upper part is about 5m high and is situated within the hotel premises(2nd pic). Lower water fall is of 65m of height, comparatively larger (1st pic) and more beautiful. Both are real beauty of nature. Highly recommend to have a visit there.
The most thrilling and amazing place I've been. For best experience you have to go ito the water fall. Safe place.
you can see them and take your picture from the road, i dont know if its worth to walk to get closer

Most of the picture posted here had a very good angle 😜 it‘s a nice waterfall, but there are not many places to hang out. As you cannot really swim at the waterfall, they built a little rock pool, which looks a bit forgotten and is not very inviting to swim. If you pass by, it may be worth a shot, but don‘t expect a mind blowing waterfall to spend a day.

Review Title: “Water is the most perfect traveller because when it travels it becomes the path itself!”
Review Text: really a wonderful place, went there on my way to Sembuwatta, in the dry season water is less but massive water in the rainy season. I loved the environment and its nature.. Entrance Fee: 100 Good place for photography and selfies... Great place to spend the day, have a dip in the pool. This is along the Elkaduwa, Wattegama Road. a car could easily get to the entrance point. I wish to visit this place again, then will do another write up with more things of leisure. by the way special tour packages can be arranged for ladies/ family and cooperate events. Please call: 0750797356
Strange that its not so popular place. But its good! :) Fantastic nature around and no tourist. U can visit also Amaya Hunnas Fall hotel. Great place for relax with a beast view.

We just went there on our way to Amaya Hunnas Falls. There's a ticket counter the price was 100 LAKE. Inside there's a good area for lesure activities. You can do in groups to spend the day like. We got two packs of lunch there had it in the cool breeze of water fall. You.cam even have adip in the cold water and there's a place to even play music.

Hunnasgiriya Waterfall (or Hunas Falls as called by many) is really a beautiful waterfall. It is highly recommended to visit this place. You can reach so close to the waterfall easily via the footpath. You can also have a bath at the built pool below the waterfall. You have to travel about 3km after turning from Elkaduwa Road. Vehicle parking is available at the entrance. You will have to buy entrance tickets. Hunnasgiriya Waterfall is situated close to Sembuwatta Lake.

We drove for over 30 minutes from a main road to get to the Hunnas Falls, there is now a ticketing desk to see it up close and swim at the base. We stopped on the road but can see the natural beauty from anywhere. Being locals no one was there to hassle us to buy any tickets. We stopped on our way Hunas Falls by Amaya for a swim and lunch.
It is a very relax and mind blowing place to go. The environment is cannot describe, it's feels like you are in a jungle with all the luxury facilities.
